thread.title: New Canaan volleyball still alive in CIAC playoff hunt
thread.title_full: New Canaan volleyball still alive in CIAC playoff hunt

author: Dave Stewart
title: New Canaan volleyball still alive in CIAC playoff hunt
text:
By Dave Stewart on October 21, 2015 in FCIAC , High School Sports , Sports , Sports Lead · 0 Comments 
Time is running short for the New Canaan Rams’ volleyball team. 
With a 3-1 loss to the Staples Wreckers Monday at New Canaan High School, the Rams are now 4-10 and would need to win four of their final five matches in order to qualify for the state playoffs. 
They’ll face teams at or below the .500 mark in the next four contests, playing at St. Joseph (8-8), home against Central (1-12), at Wilton (3-12) and home against Danbury (5-9), before wrapping the regular season with a home game against Greenwich (11-1) on Oct. 30. 
New Canaan and Staples were tied at 1-1 after two sets on Monday before the Wreckers pulled away for a 25-15, 22-25, 25-16, 25-14 win. 
For the Rams, Haley Wheeler led the offense with 12 kills, and Carson Allstead had seven kills. Carey Callahan had nine digs, Maggie Tensen had eight digs, Paige Skrim had two kills and three blocks, and Hailey Paddock had one kill and three blocks. 
Staples (10-6) had 10 kills, two digs and one block from Ginny Gerig, while Reece Schachne had eight kills, and Maya Lawande had 20 assists and three digs. 
The Rams’ last victory was a 3-1 decision against the Norwalk Bears on Oct. 7 in Norwalk. New Canaan won the first two sets before the Bears took the third. The Rams then nailed down the fourth set for a 25-16, 25-20, 23-25, 25-19 victory. 
Wheeler racked up 14 kills, 10 service points, and two digs, while Paddock had 12 kills and four blocks. Brindisi added 20 assists and five digs. 
Ludlowe swept the Rams 3-0 on Friday, Oct. 9, winning by scores of 25-16, 25-18, and 25-17. 
For New Canaan, Sara Brindisi had 20 assists and Wheeler had eight kills and six service points. 
For Ludlowe, Alice Nelson had 22 digs and service points, and Kylie McCaffery had four aces, eight service points, nine kills and 12 digs. 
New Canaan lost a tough first set to the Warde Mustangs and lost a 28-26, 25-13, 25-20 match at NCHS last Wednesday. 
Nicole Vaccarella had five service points, 12 kills and eight blocks for Warde (10-5), and Clare Burns added 17 service points, three aces, eight kills and five digs. 
For New Canaan, Brindisi had 10 assists; Paddock had five blocks and two kills; Wheeler had seven kills, five digs and two aces; Tensen had nine digs; Molly Rochlin had 11 service points; and Callahan had nine digs. New Canaan’s Julia DeNey digs out a shot during a volleyball match at NCHS. The Rams’ playoff chances are on edge, as they’ll need to win four of the final five matches to qualify. — Dave Stewart photo
